questions.question: Assuming you just launched a new business selling organic skincare products, what would be your first step in building a strong brand?
options: A) Create a fancy logo before anything else
B) Define what makes your products unique and develop a brand message
C) Copy the branding of a popular skincare brand

questions.question: Imagine you own a restaurant known for delicious home-cooked meals. Customers always say, 'Your meals taste just like grandma's cooking!' What aspect of branding does this represent?
options: A) Logo design
B) Brand perception (what people think and feel about your business)
C) Store location

questions.question: You’re helping a friend start a shoe business. She asks, 'What’s the difference between a brand and branding?' What’s the best way to explain it to her?
options: A) A brand is what customers think about your business, while branding is what you do to shape their perception
B) A brand is the name of the business, and branding is the color of the logo
C) A brand is a physical store, and branding is how you decorate it

questions.question: Assuming you run a bakery, how can branding help you sell more cakes?
options: A) By changing your logo and name every month to attract attention
B) By baking random flavors without a unique identity
C) By using consistent packaging, messaging, and quality to build trust with customers

questions.question: Your cousin is opening a clothing brand and needs help choosing brand colors. She wants people to associate her brand with trust and professionalism. Which color should she consider?
options: A) Red
B) Blue
C) Yellow

questions.question: Imagine you’re launching a travel agency. What should be your Unique Selling Proposition (USP) to stand out?
options: A) 'We sell travel tickets'
B) 'Travel with us, or don’t—your choice!'
C) 'We help travelers book stress-free vacations with exclusive discounts and 24/7 support'

questions.question: Assume you walk into a supermarket to buy soft drinks. You see Coca-Cola and an unknown brand with the same price. Why are you likely to pick Coca-Cola?
options: A) Because Coca-Cola bottles are heavier
B) Because supermarkets hide the unknown brand
C) Because it has been consistently branded to build trust and recognition

questions.question: You are designing a logo for your new tech startup. What is the most important thing to consider?
options: A) It should have at least five colors to stand out
B) It should be simple and easy to recognize
C) It should change every month to keep things fresh

questions.question: You have two phone brands to choose from: One is a trusted brand known for durability, and the other is a new, unknown brand with no reputation. Which one are you more likely to buy, and why?
options: A) The unknown brand because it’s a mystery
B) The trusted brand because branding builds customer confidence
C) The unknown brand because popular brands are overrated

questions.question: Assuming you own a hair salon and want to make your brand stand out, which strategy would work best?
options: A) Offering services randomly without a consistent brand message
B) Creating a brand identity with a unique logo, colors, and customer experience
C) Changing your business name frequently to get attention
